Racketeering.definition: the extortion of money or advantage by threat or force 2

1.definition: the extortion of money or advantage by threat or force

2.definition: a pattern of illegal activity (as extortion and murder) that is carried out in furtherance of an enterprise (as a criminal syndicate) which is owned or controlled by those engaged in such activity see alsoin the Important Laws section compare
